meanings.definition: A person living next door to or near another.
meanings.sent1: My neighbours always wave hello when I see them outside.
meanings.sent2: I borrowed some sugar from my neighbours yesterday.
meanings.sent3: The neighbours' cat sneaks into our yard to play with our dog.
meanings.sent4: The street party brought all the neighbours together for a fun evening.
meanings.sent5: The neighbours' children set up a lemonade stand in the summer.

meanings.definition: To be situated next to or near something.
meanings.sent1: Our house neighbours a beautiful park.
meanings.sent2: The grocery store neighbours the post office in our town.
meanings.sent3: The playground neighbours the school, making it convenient for the kids.
meanings.sent4: The coffee shop perfectly neighbours the bookstore, creating a cozy atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The hiking trail neighbours a serene lake, offering a picturesque view.

meanings.definition: To be friendly or helpful to someone in need.
meanings.sent1: The community always neighbours each other during tough times.
meanings.sent2: Neighbours should always be willing to lend a helping hand.
meanings.sent3: The kind old lady neighbours everyone on the block, offering cookies and smiles.
meanings.sent4: In times of crisis, it's heartwarming to see how people come together to neighbour one another.
meanings.sent5: The neighbors' generosity truly neighbours those in need, showing true compassion.
